title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the number of people that are unemployed as 63,000 and/or does not show the work.

Unemployed=Unemployment Rate×Labor Force Participation Rate×Adult Population                       =9%×70%×1,000,000                       =63,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@AA26@

The response calculates the number of people that are unemployed as 63,000 and shows the work.

Unemployed=Unemployment Rate×Labor Force Participation Rate×Adult Population                       =9%×70%×1,000,000                       =63,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@AA26@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the country of Zeta is currently experiencing a recessionary gap and/or does not explain that the current unemployment rate (9%) is higher than the natural rate of unemployment (5%).
The response states that the country of Zeta is currently experiencing a recessionary gap and explains that the current unemployment rate (9%) is higher than the natural rate of unemployment (5%).

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not accurately include either of the criteria below.

  • States that the labor force participation rate will decrease and explains that the labor force will decrease because the workers who stopped looking for employment are no longer considered to be unemployed.

  • States that the unemployment rate will decrease.

The response does not accurately include one of the criteria below.

  • States that the labor force participation rate will decrease and explains that the labor force will decrease because the workers who stopped looking for employment are no longer considered to be unemployed.

  • States that the unemployment rate will decrease.

The response includes both criteria below.

  • States that the labor force participation rate will decrease and explains that the labor force will decrease because the workers who stopped looking for employment are no longer considered to be unemployed.

  • States that the unemployment rate will decrease.
